text: is a railway station on the Hokuriku Main Line in the town of Minamiechizen, Fukui Prefecture, Japan, operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West). ==Lines== Yunoo Station is served by the Hokuriku Main Line, and is located 68.7 kilometers from the terminus of the line at . ==Station layout== The station consists of two opposed side platforms connected by a footbridge to a log cabin-style station building. The station is unattended. ===Platforms=== == Adjacent stations == ==History== Yunoo Station opened on 1 September 1948. With the privatization of Japanese National Railways (JNR) on 1 April 1987, the station came under the control of JR West. ==Passenger statistics== In fiscal 2016, the station was used by an average of 97 passengers daily (boarding passengers only). ==Surrounding area== *Yunoo Pass * * ==See also== * List of railway stations in Japan ==References== ==External links== * Category:Railway stations in Fukui Prefecture Category:Stations of West Japan Railway Company Category:Railway stations in Japan opened in 1948 Category:Hokuriku Main Line Category:Minamiechizen, Fukui
title: Yunoo Station
